page.title: 16COMMUNICATIONS - GENERAL
page.content: THE TELEPHONE PLAYS A LARGE ROLE IN THE LIFE OF MOST OF THE HOUSEHOLDS WITHIN OUR GRID. ALL THE MARKED FARMS HAVE A TELEPHONE AS THEY ARE QUITE ISOLATED ESPECIALLY CANK FARM, WHICH HAS THREE HOUSES AND ALL HAVE A TELEPHONE. AT LEAST 8O% OF THE OTHER HOUSEHOLDS HAVE A TELEPHONE, MANY WITH EXTENSIONS IN THE BEDROOM. PUBLIC TELEPHONE BOXES ARE SITED IN BOTH VILLAGES. THE POSTAL SERVICE IS STILL QUITE GOOD WITH DELIVERIES AND COLLECTIONS TWICE DAILY MONDAY TO FRIDAY AND ONCE ON SATURDAY. LOCAL NEWSPAPERS ARE DELIVERED FREE OF CHARGE TO MOST HOUSES AND THESE KEEP PEOPLE INFORMED OF LOCAL AFFAIRS. ADVANCE NOTICE OF EVENTS LIKE JUMBLE SALES, GYMKHANAS AND HOUSES / GOODS FOR SALE IS ALSO PUBLISHED IN THESE NEWSPAPERS.
